intro: Ozoroa kassneri var. rhodesica, commonly known as the Rhodesian ozoroa, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and often compound leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces legume-like pods that contain the seeds. Ozoroa kassneri var. rhodesica is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
